heisig_chinese_memo: When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind fish.
heisig_constituent: fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue
heisig_story: The composition of this kanji shows three elements, which we list in the order of their writing: bound up . . . rice field . . . cooking fire. Not much to work with at first sight. But we can join them together by thinking of a three-part story: first a fish is caught and bound up on a line with its unfortunate school-mates; when the fisherman gets home, he cuts off the head and tosses it, with the entrails, out into the rice fields for fertilizer; and the rest he sets in a skillet over a cooking fire for his supper.
koohiiStory1: The elements of this kanji are bound up, rice field and cooking fire. When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind fish.
koohiiStory2: Bind that FISH and cook his brains! Yarhh!
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The radical fish and the kanji fish are exactly the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You catch a fish. As you pull it out of the water, it starts yelling and pointing: "GO!" („Åé„Çá). "GO GYO GYO GYO!" There's a huge cruise ship coming right towards your little fishing boat. No wonder the fish was yelling GO at you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Have him continue to scream "GO GYO GYO GYO!" as you try to get your engine started and attempt to flee your impending doom. The fish helps too, because he's pretty worried as well.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the corner (‚∫à) of the rice field (Áî∞) roasting on a fire (ÁÅ¨) is a fish
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To make sushi fish is chopped up on the cutting board (floor) and bound up in rice.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Eagle-Shaped Pottery vessel (5000-3000 BC) (È≠ö, È±º, yu=y√º, fish) This is a fish figure. The top is the head of the fish, the middle part is a body, and the bottom is the tail fin.
humanum_full_description_en:
Like a fish. "Shuowen" says: "Fish, water worms. Pictograms. Fish tails are similar to swallowtails. All fish belong to fish." The ancients generally called animals worms, so "water worms" refer to water animals.

The character of fish in the oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions has a higher level of figure and pictogram. Later, for the convenience of writing, the ancients replaced the original writing with relatively straight lines. After the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period, the tail of the fish gradually became " fire " (Luo Zhenyu, Ji Xusheng). Duan Yucai's commentary in "Shuowen" also mentioned: "Its tail is all branches, so it looks like a branch, not from the fire."

The oracle bone inscriptions are mostly used as fish and shrimp, such as "Collection" 16203: "Jia Shen Bu, not its net fish." In addition, the oracle bone inscriptions also have the meaning of Jiamei, such as "Compilation" 14591: "It rains today and it is in Fu. Fish". Later, the fish character that records this word plus " kou " is differentiated into the character " Lu ". See " Lu ".

The word "fish in gold" is also used as the fish of fish and shrimp, such as "Shi (Shi) Yi (Gi) Gong Yu San Hundred". In addition, Mao Gongding also mentioned "fish §∞à (ÁÆô)", which can be compared with "The Book of Songs. Xiaoya. "Cai Wei" "Xiang Mi Yufu" and other handed down documents. "Fish ÁÆô" refers to a quiver in the shape of a fish, or a quiver decorated with fish skin or scales. In addition, fish can be understood as " fishing ", "‰∞ª", and "‰±∑", which means fishing, such as Jingding "Xinmao, Wang Yu (fishing) in Yanchi, Hu (calling) Jing Congyu (fishing)" ". Fish can also be used as the name of a person or clan.
humanum_short_description_en: Like a fish. The ancients used to generically refer to animals in water.

Like a fish. "Shuowen" says: "Fish, water worms. Pictograms. Fish tails are similar to swallowtails. All fish belong to fish." The ancients generally called animals worms, so "water worms" refer to water animals. The character of fish in the oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions has a higher level of figure and pictogram. Later, for the convenience of writing, the ancients replaced the original writing with relatively straight lines. After the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period, the tail of the fish gradually became " fire" (Luo Zhenyu, Ji Xusheng). Duan Yucai's commentary in "Shuowen" also mentioned: "Its tail is all branches, so it looks like a branch, not from the fire." The oracle bone inscriptions are mostly used as fish and shrimp, such as "Collection" 16203: "Jia Shen Bu, not its net fish." In addition, the oracle bone inscriptions also have the meaning of Jiamei, such as "Compilation" 14591: "It rains today and it is in Fu. Fish". Later, the fish character that records this word plus " kou" is differentiated into the character " Lu". See " Lu". The word "fish in gold" is also used as the fish of fish and shrimp, such as "Shi (Shi) Yi (Gi) Gong Yu San Hundred". In addition, Mao Gongding also mentioned "fish §∞à (ÁÆô)", which can be compared with "The Book of Songs. Xiaoya. "Cai Wei" "Xiang Mi Yufu" and other handed down documents. "Fish ÁÆô" refers to a quiver in the shape of a fish, or a quiver decorated with fish skin or scales. In addition, fish can be understood as " fishing", " ‰∞ª", and " ‰±∑", which means fishing, such as Jingding "Xinmao, Wang Yu (fishing) in Yanchi, Hu (calling) Jing Congyu (fishing)" ". Fish can also be used as the name of a person or clan.

fish
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªy√∫ÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Yu Qiqi, flat fish, suspicious. ]
Traditional characters for "È±º1".
(1) Aquatic vertebrates. Body temperature changes with the outside temperature. The body is generally flat, with scales and fins. Breathe with gills. There are many types, most of which can be eaten or made into isinglass.
(2) The name of some aquatic animals like fish.
(3) A horse with white eyes.
(4) Names of acupoints in Chinese medicine. The palm (or metatarsal) bones behind the thumbs (or feet) of the fingers and hands have obvious muscle bulges, which resemble the belly of a fish.
(5) The treasures of ancient officials. Namely fish bag.
(6) Letters.
(7) Silverfish.
(8) Wooden fish.
(9) The ancient word "fishing". Fishing.
(10) The ancient word "fishing". Obtain. See "fish drink".
(11) Substitute word for the date of the message. That is six days. "Fish" is listed as the sixth rhyme of Shangping in Pingshuiyun, so it refers to six days in the telegram.
(12) Link "I". pronoun. Table first person singular.
(13) Star name. Belongs to Ojuku.
(14) Ancient country name. The old city is located in Chijia Mountain in the northeast of Fengjie, Sichuan. Yufu County was once set up in the Qin and Han Dynasties.
(15) Last name. Tang Youyu Chaoen. See "Old Tang Book¬∑The Eunuch's Biography".
fish

[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] „ÄÄÈ±º; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 1465 No. 01
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Yu Juqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Niu Juqie,? Yuping sound. [Said the text] This work? Water bugs are also. Pictogram, similar to dovetail. [Note] Xu Kai said: The fire is just like a tail, not a fire of water or fire. [Rhyme Club] Li Provincial Zuoyu. „ÄêYi¬∑Zhongfu„ÄëPoppy fish lucky. [Note] The fisher is also the hermit of the worm. [Ritual¬∑Yoshitou] Fish?. [Note] The fish has no wings. „ÄêHistorical Records¬∑Zhou Benji„ÄëThe white fish jumped into the Wang Zhou. [Note] Ma Rong said: The fish are like scales, and also like soldiers. The silverfish, also known as the silver fish, is born in Materia Medica, and has been stored in silk and paper for a long time. Also „ÄêPoetry¬∑Xiaoya„ÄëXiang Mi Yufu. [Biography] Fish clothes, fish skin. „ÄêLu Ji Shu„Äëfish clothing, the skin of fish and beasts. Like a pig, there is it in the East China Sea. A fish raccoon with a scorpion on its back and a pure belly underneath it. Now he thinks it is a bow and a fork. Also [Tang Shu¬∑Car Service History] The turtle bag was first stopped, and the fish was given again. [Liao History¬∑Xingzong Ji] Try to be a scholar of Yu Ting, and give Feng Li and other red-clothed silverfish. [Jin Shi¬∑Yufu Zhi] The prince wears jade fish, first to fourth grade goldfish, and silver fish below. Also [Zuo Zhuan¬∑Min Ernian] Returned to Mrs. Yu Xuan. [Note] Decorated with fish skin. Also horse name. „ÄêErya¬∑Shihu„ÄëTwo eyes white, fish. [Note] It's like fish eyes. „ÄêPoetry¬∑Lu Song„ÄëThere are scouts and fishes. Also place name. [Zuo Zhuan¬∑Xi 2nd Year] Diaolou, a native of Qisi, learned from Yu Duoyu. Also„ÄêSixteenth year of the text„ÄëBut if you benefit from fish, people are actually chasing them. [Note] Yu, Yufu County

È±º

Radicals: È≠ö  (fish)
Meaning Mnemonic
The radical fish and the kanji fish are exactly the same!
Nothing fishy about that, right?
Reading Mnemonic
You catch a fish. As you pull it out of the water, it starts yelling and pointing: "GO!" („Åé„Çá). "GO GYO GYO GYO!" There's a huge cruise ship coming right towards your little fishing boat. No wonder the fish was yelling GO at you.
Have him continue to scream "GO GYO GYO GYO!" as you try to get your engine started and attempt to flee your impending doom. The fish helps too, because he's pretty worried as well.
